creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
markings:
each page showing the scene of special products being made;
Treasure Market at Sumiyoshi(Sumiyoshi takara-ichi)
Grass Noodle Making at Miwa in Yamato Province(Yamato Miwa so_men)
Haevesting Burdocks of Iyo(Iyo gobo_)
Drying Tangles(Matsumae konbu)
Making Charcoal(Sho-en tori no zu)
Making Sedge Hats at Kaga(Kaga gasa)
Cow Market at Tenno_ji(Tenno_ji ushi-ichi)
Pottery Making at Fukakusa in Kyo_to(Kyo_ Fukakusa kawarake)
Beach Market at Miyajima in Aki Province(Aki no Miyajima hama-ichi)
Boat Festival at Miyajima(Miyajima fune matsuri)
Bamboo Basket Shop at Arima(Arima kago zaiku)
Washing Linen at Nara(Nara sarashi)
Rush Mat Making at Ibuki(Ibuki igusa)
Making Fans at Koyama in Kowachi Province(Kawachi Koyama uchiwa)Paper Making at sendai in O_shu_ Province(O_shu_ Sendai kamiko)
Mashroom Market at Ichikawa, Tenma(Tenma Ichikawa matsutake ichi)
Making Dried Rice at Do_myo_ji Temple(Do_myo_ji hoshi-ii)
medium: Woodblock printed book; ink on paper
title: Famous Products from Mountain and Sea vol. 4
